snippet.title: A Cartridge for a Lost Nintendo System | Things of Interest
snippet.description:
Less known than the Satellaview? Yup. More obscure than the Nintendo Power flashcart? You bet. Let's talk about the Nintendo Game Processor, a long lost Super Famicom dev kit from the mid-90s...and how bits and pieces of its history were saved from being lost to time.

Further reading:

LuigiBlood's Game Processor page (contains links to other sources, flyer images and more):
https://luigiblood.neocities.org/gameprocessor

Game Processor US patents:
https://patents.google.com/patent/US5592609A/en

One of the Satellaview Game Processor broadcasts:
https://youtu.be/ez79CMBcFe8

Asterisk's Great Adventure soundtrack:
https://youtu.be/HUT4jCmr7WA

More Things of Interest:
➤ https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLVA-t0elasOwwM4gNoHM5I9pRqFPLE4LR

00:00 Intro
00:37 History of the Game Processor
03:55 What is the RAM Casette?
05:41 Reviving the RAM Casette
07:35 Asterisk's Great Adventure
11:17 Epilogue

➤ Extra videos on @AkfamilyhomePlus!

Exclusive videos, early access and more for as little as 1 USD a month!

#Nintendo #GameProcessor #SuperFamicom #SNES
